section1.title:
Positive Influence,
Lasting Memories
section1.description: Ultimately, I decided to support the expansion of the School of Computing through my donation.
section1.speaker:
ByungGyu Chang,
KRAFTON Chairman and 
KAIST School of Computing 
Alumnus, said

section2.title:
KRAFTON X SoC,
Design Story
section2.description: This space began with a single word: connection. Along the way, we reflected deeply on how that connection can truly be experienced.

section3.title:
Where Positive
Influence Comes
Full Circle
section3.description: This is a space of connection where we pay it forward with gratitude to our juniors.
section3.descriptionDesktop: This is a space of connection where we pay it forward with gratitude to our juniors.
section3.speaker:
Sukyoung Ryu, 
Head of the KAIST School of 
Computing, said

message.desktop:
“I first met Professor Young-Gul Kim, Executive Director of the KAIST Development Foundation, in October 2017. That encounter led to the beginning of donations such as the KAIST-Indonesia Volunteer Corps, and the trust built through this relationship eventually extended to the KAIST 50th Anniversary Memorial Hall project, which was initiated around 2020 by President Sung-Chul Shin.

While meeting various people involved in the 50th Anniversary Memorial Hall project, I had the opportunity to meet Professor Myung-Ho Kim, then Head of the School of Computing. At that time, I decided to dedicate a portion of the donation I had pledged to KAIST to the expansion of the School of Computing. Around that period, I also began exchanging thoughts with several fellow alumni and acquaintances, which ultimately led to KRAFTON’s 11 billion KRW matching grant donation in 2021.”
message.tablet:
“제가 KAIST 발전재단 상임이사 김영걸 교수님을 처음 만난 것은 2017년 10월이었습니다. 
이 인연으로 KAIST-인도네시아 봉사단 같은 기부가 시작되었고, 이 신뢰 관계는 
2020년 즈음 신성철 총장님이 추진하신 50주년 기념관 사업까지 이어졌습니다.

50주년 기념관 관련하여 여러 사람들을 만나는 중 전산학부 학부장 김명호 교수님을 만났고,
당시 제가 KAIST에 약정한 기부금 중 일부는 전산학부 증축에 쓰겠다고 결심했습니다.
 이 즈음부터 모교 출신인 여러 동료이자 지인들과 이야기가 오갔고, 
결과적으로 2021년 110억원 크래프톤 매칭 그랜트 기부까지 이어졌습니다.”
message.mobile:
“제가 KAIST 발전재단 상임이사 김영걸 교수님을 처음 만난 것은 2017년 10월이었습니다. 
이 인연으로 KAIST-인도네시아 봉사단 같은 기부가 시작되었고, 이 신뢰 관계는 
2020년 즈음 신성철 총장님이 추진하신 50주년 기념관 사업까지 이어졌습니다.

50주년 기념관 관련하여 여러 사람들을 만나는 중 전산학부 학부장 김명호 교수님을 만났고,
당시 제가 KAIST에 약정한 기부금 중 일부는 전산학부 증축에 쓰겠다고 결심했습니다.
 이 즈음부터 모교 출신인 여러 동료이자 지인들과 이야기가 오갔고, 
결과적으로 2021년 110억원 크래프톤 매칭 그랜트 기부까지 이어졌습니다.”

chairmanMessage.introduction: KAIST 전산학부 동문 장병규 KRAFTON 의장

content.desktop:
When the first discussions began, the question we asked was: “What meaning will this space hold for its users?” Rather than seeing it as a finished product, we aimed to make invisible positive impact visible through space.

This space stands as a tangible point of connection within a larger flow—a marker, not an endpoint. We hope it becomes a starting point for new connection.

May those who experience this space feel part of a greater chain of change—and discover the connections they, too, will create.

When the first discussions began, the question we asked was: “What meaning will this space hold for its users?” Rather than seeing it as a finished product, we aimed to make invisible positive impact visible through space.

This space stands as a tangible point of connection within a larger flow—a marker, not an endpoint. We hope it becomes a starting point for new connections.

May those who experience this space feel part of a greater chain of change—and discover the connections they, too, will create.

content.desktop:
The KRAFTON X SoC space was created as a place where people stay, connect, and share new ideas—linking knowledge and people, technology and people, and people to people, with humanity at the center.

It began with a single word: connection. Along the way, we reflected deeply on how that connection can truly be experienced.

subTitle.desktop:
This exploration of connection began with a shared belief between the KAIST School of Computing and
KRAFTON: a human-centric philosophy — the clear value that technological advancement must
ultimately serve humanity.
subTitle.tablet:
This exploration of connection began with a shared belief
between the KAIST School of Computing and KRAFTON: 
a human-centric philosophy — the clear value
that technological advancement must
ultimately serve humanity.
subTitle.mobile: This exploration of connection began with a shared belief between the KAIST School of Computing and KRAFTON: a human-centric philosophy — the clear value that technological advancement must ultimately serve humanity.

Card1.title: Human-Centered Ideology
Card1.content: We believe that the true value of design lies in its ability to connect people and technology, and that the best designs are those that are human-centered and user-friendly.

wish.desktop:
Just as countless hidden techniques are required in architecture to erase a
single visible line, this space, too, pushes beyond structural and technical
limits to quietly optimize a sense of calm. We hope that all of these efforts
are seamlessly embedded into the space—so that our intentions are fully felt
by the students and everyone who visits here.
